qas.question: What new product did Bank of America introduce in 1958?
What was the name of the first successful credit card?
What did the BankAmericard allow customers do to that they couldn't do with previous financial instruments?

answers.text: a financial instrument that was usable across a large number of merchants and also allowed cardholders to revolve a balance

qas.question: In what year did BankAmericard change its name?
What present-day company did BankAmericard turn into?
What month did the BankAmericard creator resign?
What was the original name of the BankAmericard?
The BankAmericard could be used across many merchants but could not do what?
What year did the BankAmericard become successful?

context: In <b5_0>September 1958<b5_0/>, Bank of America launched a new product called <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a1_0>BankAmericard<a1_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> in <b9_0>Fresno<b9_0/>. After a troubled gestation during which its creator resigned, <a1_1><a1_2>BankAmericard<a1_2/><a1_1/> went on to become the first successful credit card; that is, <a2_1>a financial instrument that was usable across a large number of merchants and also allowed cardholders <a2_0>to <a2_2><b7_0>revolve a balance<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> (earlier financial products could do one or the other but not both). In <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b8_0>1976<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>, BankAmericard was renamed and spun off into a separate company known today as <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b6_0>Visa Inc.
